meanings.definition: To express or represent in the form of an epigram.
meanings.sent1: She epigrammatized her feelings about the situation in a short and witty way.
meanings.sent2: The writer epigrammatized the complex idea into a clever and concise statement.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he epigrammatized the embarrassing incident with humor and charm.
meanings.sent4: Her words epigrammatized the essence of love in a single sentence.
meanings.sent5: The comedian epigrammatized the absurdity of everyday life with sharp wit.

meanings.definition: To make a concise, clever, and witty statement.
meanings.sent1: He epigrammatized his thoughts on the matter with a clever twist.
meanings.sent2: The poet epigrammatized the beauty of nature in a few well-chosen words.
meanings.sent3: The student epigrammatized the boring lecture to make his classmates laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her speech epigrammatized the importance of kindness in a world of chaos.
